channel.title: Cinema IRL
channel.description: Movies give us countless scenarios and situations the characters have to navigate. Well, how would YOU handle these situations in you were in their place? Amber, Scott and the occasional guest tackle this very topic. We're not a review show, but there are enough opinions between us you'll get a little of that too. We mostly try to keep it lighthearted and funny. Sometimes we succeed, sometimes not so much, but it's usually entertaining nonetheless.
channel.itunes:author: Unknown

item.title: E189 - Americana - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E189 - Americana - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discuss "Americana," a crime thriller centered around the theft of a priceless Native American ghost shirt. The film follows a waitress and a veteran as they pursue the stolen artifact, encountering violence, cultural clashes, and unexpected twists along the way. Their journey involves a surprisingly good child actor, a loveable but impulsive veteran, and a darkly comedic look at cultural appropriation. The discussion includes lively debate on the film's themes and memorable scenes.

item.title: E165 - 28 Years Later - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E165 - 28 Years Later - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: This week on Cinema IRL, it's just Scott and Jimmy as they dissect "28 Years Later"... without Amber's calming influence. Scott struggles to keep the show on the rails as they delve into the rage-filled world of the "R" virus zombies. Jimmy, our resident zombie expert, draws sharp distinctions between the "R" virus and his own "T" virus, leading to some surprisingly philosophical and hilarious debates. They discuss the movie's questionable plot points, like zombie safaris and pregnant zombies, and delve into the ethics of human-zombie relations. Plus, Jimmy gives his *very* strong opinions on the Alpha zombies. What is it? Find out now on Cinema IRL!

item.title: E163 - I Don't Understand You - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E163 - I Don't Understand You - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Ciao, chaos! This week on Cinema IRL, we're diving headfirst into the dark, darkly comedic Italian nightmare that is "I Don't Understand You." Dom and Cole, a loving couple on the cusp of adoption, find their anniversary trip to Italy spiraling out of control faster than you can say "oopsie-daisy" after accidentally killing a dinner host. Get ready for a hilarious dissection of escalating bad decisions, cultural misunderstandings, and the age-old question: what *would* you do if you accidentally became a murderer on vacation? From language barriers to multiple accidental deaths, we're tackling all the absurdities, and of course, judging their questionable choices every step of the way. Plus, we unpack *that* vegetarian scene... *shudders*.

item.title: E162 - The Phoenician Scheme - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E162 - The Phoenician Scheme - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Welcome back to Cinema IRL, where we dive deep into films and ask the important questions... like, what *is* "the gap" in international finance? This week, we’re unraveling the stylishly bizarre and utterly baffling world of *The Phoenician Scheme* (Episode 163). Picture this: a family business, corporate intrigue, and enough assassination attempts to make James Bond blush. But trust us, the official synopsis doesn't even scratch the surface of this star-studded cinematic enigma. Buckle up as we dissect the plot, ponder moral dilemmas, and try to figure out just what *The Phoenician Scheme* is actually about. Is it a miss or a hidden gem? Let's find out!

item.title: E159 - Bring Her Back - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E159 - Bring Her Back - What Would YOU Do?
item.description:
Get ready for a wild ride, folks! This week on Cinema IRL, we dive deep into the unsettling world of "Bring Her Back." A brother and sister stumble upon a disturbing ritual at their new foster home, involving necromancy, body parts, and a desperate attempt to resurrect the foster mother's deceased daughter.

Was it a zombie film? A vampire flick? Or something far more sinister involving dark arts? Join our hosts as they dissect the film's gory details, debate its genre, and grapple with the moral quandary at its heart: Would you sacrifice another life to bring back a loved one? Be warned: this episode is not for the faint of heart!

item.title: E158 - Karate Kid Legends - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E158 - Karate Kid Legends - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Wax on, wax off, and pizza delivered from New York! This week on Cinema IRL, we're diving headfirst into the latest *Karate Kid* installment, "Karate Kid Legends." We dissect the plot twists (spoiler alert!), debate the characters' fighting abilities, and even uncover surprising real-life parallels. Plus, what would *you* do if sucker-punched on the subway? Join us as we grapple with the film's highs, lows, and that *one* thing that REALLY bothered us.

item.title: E157 - Jane Austen Wrecked My Life - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E157 - Jane Austen Wrecked My Life - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Welcome back to Cinema IRL! This week, we're diving headfirst into the awkward world of French rom-coms with "Jane Austen Wrecked My Life." A struggling bookseller, a writer's retreat run by Jane Austen's distant relatives, and a whole lot of romantic confusion – what could possibly go wrong? Our hosts dissect this film's messy love triangles, questionable decisions, and the age-old debate of whether men and women can truly be "just friends." Get ready for some seriously relatable "What Would You Do?" scenarios, language barrier faux pas, and a discussion about the ethics of drunk sex (yes, really!). Tune in for a hilarious and thought-provoking conversation that will leave you questioning all your life choices.

item.title: E156 - Final Destination Bloodlines - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E156 - Final Destination Bloodlines - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Death is coming, and this time it's personal...ly gruesome! This week on Cinema IRL, we dive headfirst (sometimes literally) into "Final Destination: Bloodlines." We discuss Stephanie's family curse, inherited from a grandmother plagued by premonitions. Is Iris crazy, or is she the only one who can outsmart Death himself? We ponder the film's elaborate death traps, debate abandoning cursed families, and ask the important questions: peanut allergy or metal coil through the head? Plus, are there enough warning signs before someone goes out for cigarettes and never returns? Get ready to suspend your disbelief and brace yourself for some epicly creative carnage!

Plus, are there enough warning signs before someone goes out for cigarettes and never returns? Get ready to suspend your disbelief and brace yourself for some epicly creative carnage!

item.description: Aloha, Cinema IRL Ohana! item.title: E148 - Friendship - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E148 - Friendship - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: mber and Scott dive into the uncomfortable truth about adult friendships with a film that's basically a masterclass in social awkwardness. item.title: E145 - The Surfer - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E145 - The Surfer - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discuss The Surfer, where Nicholas Cage is full-on Nicholas Caging harder than ever - and yes, it's exactly what you probably think. item.title: E144 - Warfare - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E144 - Warfare - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott take on a very real and unflinching look at modern warfare through the eyes of soldiers who lived it, because sometimes the most important stories are the ones that make us the most uncomfortable. Written and directed by Iraq War veteran Jay Mendoza and Alex Garland, this film embeds audiences with a platoon of American Navy SEALs in an Iraqi family's home during a real-time operation. Our hosts grapple with putting themselves in the shoes of those who've experienced the unthinkable, exploring how war is hell and probably even worse than most of us can imagine. This isn't your typical action movie - it's a visceral, boots-on-the-ground story told like never before.

item.title: E143 - Until Dawn - What Would YOU Do?
item.itunes:title: E143 - Until Dawn - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Special guest Jimmy joins Amber and Scott to tackle a horror film that asks the ultimate question: are you scared of dying, especially if you knew you'd just restart the night a little more screwed up than before? When a group finds themselves stalked by a masked killer and horrifically murdered one by one, only to wake up back at the beginning of the same evening, our hosts explore the psychological nightmare of being trapped in a deadly time loop. Jimmy adds his unique perspective as they discuss what happens when your worst night becomes your eternal night. Sometimes the real horror isn't dying - it's having to live through the same terror indefinitely until you're too broken to continue.

item.title: E142 - The Shrouds - What would YOU do?
item.itunes:title: E142 - The Shrouds - What would YOU do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discover that death and technology don't mix particularly well after watching a film about a tech entrepreneur who's developed software that lets the bereaved witness their loved ones' decomposition process. Because apparently, someone thought what grief really needed was a live stream of decay with premium subscription features. Our hosts dive into this premise that had so much potential but was executed about as well as the people being monitored. When you have lots of money, tech skills, and a bit of creepiness, this is apparently how you handle loss - and it's exactly as disturbing as it sounds.

item.description: Amber and Scott navigate the complex world of chosen family, cultural identity, and accidental pregnancy in a film that combines a staged straight wedding with some very real complications. item.title: Episode 129 - Locked

item.title: Episode 110 - Heart Eyes
item.itunes:title: Episode 110 - Heart Eyes
item.description: On this episode of Cinema IRL, the hosts dissect the horror-comedy Heart Eyes, a film where a fake kiss unfortunately gets two coworkers placed on a Valentine's Day killer's hit list. This leads to a hilarious roast of the characters' bafflingly poor choices, from their questionable escape tactics to complaining about being "ditched" mid-chase. The hosts even find themselves rooting for the killer to dispatch one particularly obnoxious couple, proving that sometimes the most horrifying part of a movie is the characters themselves.

item.title: Episode 109 - Flight Risk
item.itunes:title: Episode 109 - Flight Risk
item.description: On their podcast "Cinema IRL," the hosts tackle the thriller "Flight Risk," where an air marshal's simple prisoner transport becomes a nightmare when the pilot is revealed to be a henchman. This prompts a spirited debate on the proper sky-high protocol for when you have one too many bad guys on your plane. Between questioning the logistics of stabbing-related first aid and one host's deep suspicion of a suspiciously charming radio pilot, the episode is a masterclass in cinematic second-guessing.

item.title: Episode 108 - Brave the Dark
item.itunes:title: Episode 108 - Brave the Dark
item.description: In a uniquely personal episode, the Cinema IRL podcast discusses "Brave the Dark," an intense film about a teacher helping a student with a deeply traumatic past. The movie review takes a sharp turn into reality when one of the hosts reveals he has a startlingly similar backstory of homelessness and teacher intervention. It’s a heartfelt look at the life-changing power of empathy that quickly becomes a game of "wait, this actually happened to you?".

item.title: Episode 107 - Presence
item.itunes:title: Episode 107 - Presence
item.description: The Cinema IRL podcast tackles "Presence," a film billed as the year's scariest, but the hosts were more confused than terrified. The big supernatural mystery turns out to be a baffling combination of a regular "punk kid" villain and the brother's protective spirit from the future. The movie was so unscary that the hosts shared their own spooky encounters, which were less "The Conjuring" and more "The Case of the Mysterious Backyard Beer Cans."

item.title: Episode 106 - One Of Them Days
item.itunes:title: Episode 106 - One Of Them Days
item.description: What happens when the rent money gets spent on a questionable t-shirt business? The Cinema IRL podcast breaks down "One of Them Days," a film where best friends Drew and Alisa embark on a frantic, chaotic scramble to avoid eviction. Their day spirals into a series of hilariously poor decisions, including selling blood and accidentally stealing from a local gangster. Ultimately, their evicted belongings become an impromptu, and surprisingly successful, pop-up art show, proving that sometimes hitting rock bottom comes with a creative twist.

item.title: Episode 105 - Wolf Man
item.itunes:title: Episode 105 - Wolf Man
item.description: Ever wonder if Hollywood gets werewolves right? The Cinema IRL podcast tackles the movie Wolfman with a very special guest expert: Morty, werewolf who's here to fact-check the film. Morty sets the record straight on everything from the agonizing pain of transformation to debunking the myth about silver bullets. Tune in to hear a real lycanthrope's take on his cinematic representation, including the very important question of whether you lose the ability to write a grocery list post-transformation.
